str2: A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A priest, one who offers sacrifice to a god (in Jewish and pagan religions; of Christians only met.). From hieros; a priest.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From leitourgos; to be a public servant, i.e. to perform religious or charitable functions.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From pros and phero; to bear towards, i.e. Lead to, tender, treat.
Many times, often, frequently. Multiplicative adverb from polus; many times, i.e. Frequently.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Abstr. and concr: sacrifice; a sacrifice, offering. From thuo; sacrifice.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Plural
Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
Never. From oude and pote; not even at any time, i.e. Never at all.
From peri and haireomai; to remove all around, i.e. Unveil, cast off; figuratively, to expiate.
